meta.title: Home - West Hartford Public Schools

div.a: Skip to Main Content

div.p: Our Mission is to inspire and prepare all students to realize their potential and enhance our global community.

video.div: Your web browser does not support the <video> tag.

fieldset.legend: Play and Pause Buttons for Slideshow

div.a: At-Home Learning Plans (opens in new window/tab)

div.p: We have created a flexible learning approach that delivers essential content to students in each of their courses.

div.a: April 9, 2020 COVID-19 Information for Families

div.p: Letter from Superintendent, Tom Moore

div.a: April 21 Board of Education Public Hearing on the 2020-2021 Budget

div.p: The hearing will be aired live on WHCTV and Google Hangouts Meet.

div.a: 2020-21 West Hartford Public Schools Kindergarten Registration

div.p: Kindergarten registration for the 2020-21 school year will take place online.

div.a: Stay-at-Home Campaign PSA Contest

div.p: Thank you for doing your part in helping keep our community safe!

div.a: Advanced Placement Examinations Update

div.p: This communication offers key information regarding the changes that the AP Program has taken to respond to this situation.

div.a: Update on Mandated State Testing and Saturday SAT and ACT Testing

div.p: Updates about spring testing

div.a: 2020 Census - Be Counted! (opens in new window/tab)

div.p: Parents, educators and community partners of the West Hartford Public Schools are encouraged to add your voice to the 2020 Census.

div.a: School Registration and Residency

div.p: Find out which district your street belongs to, access resources for school registration, and more!

div.a: Last day of school and high school graduation

div.p: The last day of school will be Thursday, June 18.

div.a: High School Program of Studies

div.p: Providing all students with high expectations, a rigorous and relevant curriculum, and dynamic teaching in order for them to realize their potential is the central goal of the West Hartford Public Schools’ commitment to continuous improvement.

div.a: West Hartford is a wonderful community to raise young children!

div.p: We are fortunate to have many excellent choices in early care and education!

div.a: Equity and Diversity Council

div.p: The purpose of the Equity and Diversity Council (EDC) is to support and sustain a diverse educational community that is inclusive and equitable by examining, developing, and improving systemic practices, programs, and policies.

div.a: WHPS Magnet Schools

div.p: In West Hartford, you have a choice of elementary schools!

p.meta: We invite you and your family to explore the wide range of optional resources listed here.

div.p: We have created a flexible learning approach that delivers essential content to students in each of their courses.
We have created a flexible learning approach that delivers essential content to students in each of their courses.

View Each School's Events
2019-2020 District Calendar
2020-2021 District Calendar

p.strong: Time/Money Magazine ranked the top small cities with populations between 50,000 and 300,000, and West Hartford was the only town in the state to make the top 50.

p.meta: Promoting values, contributing positively to the overall climate of the schools and community, developing respect for others, fostering positive growth and development, offering an equal opportunity for participation, and promoting personal improvement and excellence, Athletics at WHPS are so much fun!

div.p: Our high schools are ranked in the top 15 in the state, and in the top 3 percent nationally in the 2019 U.S. News & World Report ranking of the country’s public high schools!
West Hartford Public Schools’ music department is recognized as one of the Best Communities for Music Education in the United States by the National Association of Music Merchants.

The outstanding faculty of WHPS includes the CT Recipient of the Presidential Award for Excellence in Mathematics and Science Teaching, CT Teacher of the Year, the National Social Studies Teacher of the Year, the CT Assistant Principal of the Year, and the CT Elementary Principal of the Year.

The teachers, administrators, and support staff of the West Hartford Public Schools are driven by our Mission Framework and District Goals to ensure that our students experience high expectations, dynamic teaching, and a rigorous and relevant curriculum.
of the top schools in Connecticut & the Nation!

div.h5: Top High Schools in CT & Nation
div.p: The U.S. News rankings include data on more than 20,500 public schools in 50 states and the District of Columbia. Schools were awarded gold, silver or bronze medals based on their performance on state assessments and how well they prepare students for college.
languages represented in our school system

div.h5: Our schools are a tapestry of cultures and ethnicities, with over 70 languages represented in our school system.
div.p: Our students have had opportunities to travel to Europe, South America, Africa, and Asia as part of their educational program.
Magnet Schools

div.h5: Charter Oak International Academy and Florence E. Smith STEM School
div.p: West Hartford’s two magnet elementary schools begin with the same comprehensive curriculum standards as neighborhood schools, but enrich the student experience with an inquiry-based teaching and learning model. Families find that the magnet schools encourage their children to think more creatively and independently.
West Hartford is the Only Connecticut Town in Time/Money’s ‘Best Places to Live 2018’!

div.h5: Community collaboration and service are important to us
div.p: West Hartford is a wonderful town with strengths beyond just its education system!

div.div: 50 South Main St, West Hartford, CT 06107
